p: The family of Picornaviridae comprises several viruses associated with respiratory tract infections. Members of this family form non-enveloped, icosahedral virions with approximately 30 nm in diameter and a single linear, positive-sense RNA genome of 7–10 kb. It encodes for a polyprotein containing the four capsid proteins VP1-4 and the seven non-structural proteins 2A-C and 3A-D in the precursor proteins P1 and P2, respectively ( Zell et al., 2017). VP1, 2, and 3 are highly variable surface proteins which interact with antiviral antibodies. VP4 is confined to the interior of the capsid and is closely associated with the viral RNA ( Fig. 1 ).
